= |prizes = Members' Prize, Cambridge, 1765 |religion = Anglican |footnotes =
|signature = }} 'William Paley' (July 1743 â 25 May 1805) was an English
Christian apologist, philosopher, and utilitarian. He is best known for his
exposition of the teleological argument for the existence of God in his work
Natural Theology, which made use of the watchmaker analogy (also see natural
theology).
